src: Dbajte na to, aby bola vaša ruka čo najviac uvoľnená, ale snažte sa pritom správne triafať všetky noty – taktiež sa snažte nerobiť prstami veľa zbytočných pohybov. Takto sa unavíte čo najmenej. Pamätajte, že pre väčšiu hlasitosť nie je potrebné stlačiť klávesy väčšou silou ako na klavíri. Ak chcete na akoredóne dosiahnuť väčšiu hlasitosť, použite mechy s väčším tlakom alebo rýchlosťou.
mt: 1. Keep your hand as relaxed as possible, but try to hit all the notes correctly. Also try not to make your fingers do too many unnecessary movements. This way you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember that you do not need to press the keys harder than on a piano to get a louder sound. To get a louder sound on a chord, use a higher pressure or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

mt: 1. Keep your hand as relaxed as possible, but try to hit all the notes correctly. Also try not to make your fingers do too many unnecessary movements. This way you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember that you do not need to press the keys harder than on a piano to get a louder sound. To get a louder sound on a chord, use a higher pressure or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Jedným z najbežnejších problémov pri pokuse o konverziu filmu do formátu DVD je presnímanie. Prevažná väčšina televízorov je prispôsobená tak, aby vyhovovala bežným ľuďom. Z tohto dôvodu malo všetko, čo vidíte na televízore, orezané okraje, teda vrch, spodok aj boky. Toto zaisťuje, aby obraz pokrýval celú obrazovku. Hovorí sa tomu overscan. Žiaľ, pri tvorbe DVD sa jeho okraje s najväčšou pravdepodobnosťou orežú tiež. Ak by malo video titulky umiestnené príliš nízko, nezobrazia sa celé.
mt: One of the most common problems in trying to convert a film to DVD format is overscan. Most televisions are designed to accommodate the average person. As a result, everything you see on the television has cropped edges, that is, top, bottom and sides. This ensures that the image covers the entire screen. Overscan is the term used for this. Unfortunately, when creating a DVD, its edges are cropped as well. If the video subtitles are placed too low, they will not be fully visible.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Americký plán sa opieral o koordinované útoky z troch rôznych smerov. Generál John Cadwalder podnikol diverzný útok proti britskej posádke v Bordentowne, aby zablokoval prísun akýchkoľvek posíl. Generál James Ewing vzal 700 milicionárov cez rieku v Trenton Ferry, obsadil most cez potok Assunpink a zabránil nepriateľským vojskám uniknúť. Hlavná útočná zložka 2 400 mužov by prešla cez rieku deväť míľ severne od Trentonu a potom by sa rozdelila na dve skupiny. Jednu pod vedením Greena a druhú pod vedením Sullivana, aby mohli zaútočiť pred úsvitom.
mt: The American plan was based on coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder conducted a diversionary attack against the British garrison in Bordentown to block the arrival of any reinforcements. General James Ewing took 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seized the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevented the enemy forces from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton and then split into two groups. One under the command of Greene and the other under Sullivan, to attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: Po prijatí Kongresom 4. júla bol ručne písaný návrh podpísaný prezidentom Kongresu Johnom Hancockom a ministrom Charlesom Thomsonom zaslaný o pár blokov ďalej do tlačiarne Johna Dunlapa. V priebehu jedej noci bolo urobených 150 až 200 kópií. V súčasnosti sú známe ako „Dunlapove bočné strany“. Prvé verejné čítanie dokumentu predniesol John Nixon a konalo sa dňa 8. júla na dvore pri budove Independence Hall. Jeden bol 6. júla zaslaný Georgeovi Washingtonovi, ktorý ho 9. júla nechal prečítať svojim jednotkám v New Yorku. Kópia sa do Londýna dostala 10. augusta. 25 Dunlapových bočných strán stále existuje a ide o najstaršie dochované kópie dokumentu. Originálna kópia rukopisu sa nezachovala.
mt: 4 July 1776, the Second Continental Congress approved the final wording of the Declaration of Independence, and delegates signed the document on 2 August. The first public reading of the Declaration was on 8 July 1776, when it was read from the Philadelphia State House (now called Independence Hall) by Colonel John Nixon. The Declaration was first publicly read in New York on 9 July 1776, and in Boston on 14 July. 8 July 1776, the first public reading of the Declaration of Independence, by Colonel John Nixon, on the steps of the Philadelphia State House (now called Independence Hall). 9 July 1776, the first public reading of the Declaration of Independence, by George Washington, in New York City. 10 August 1776, the first public reading of the Declaration of Independence, in London. 25 Dunlap broadsides still exist and are the oldest known copies of the Declaration of Independence. The original copy of the Declaration of Independence is on display at the National Archives in Washington, D.C.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Kolonisti, ktorí videli túto činnosť, rovnako žiadali o vyslanie posíl. Medzi vojská, ktoré posilňovali popredné pozície, patrili aj 1. a 3. pluk z New Hampshire. Oba mali po 200 mužov a viedli ich plukovníci John Stark a James Reed (obaja sa neskôr stali generálmi). Starkovi muži zaujali pozície pozdĺž plotu na severnom konci od pozície „kolonistu“. Keď odliv otvoril prieluku pozdĺž rieky Mystic na severovýchode polostrova, plot rýchlo rozšírili krátkym kamenným múrom na severe, kde siahal až po okraj vody na malej pláži. Asi 30 metrov pred plotom Gridley alebo Stark umiestnili kôl a nariadili nestrieľať, kým okolo neho neprejdú vojaci.
mt: Colonists who witnessed this activity also requested reinforcements. Among the troops sent to bolster the front lines were the 1st and 3rd regiments of New Hampshire, both of which had 200 men and were led by Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both of whom later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence at the northern end of the "colonist" position. When the tide opened a breach along the river Mystic on the northeast of the peninsula, the fence was quickly extended by a short stone wall to the north, where it stretched to the edge of the water on a small beach. About 30 meters in front of the fence, Gridley or Stark placed a pail and ordered not to fire until troops passed around it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Staroveká Čína poznala jedinečný spôsob zobrazovania rôznych časových období; každé hisotrické obdobie Číny alebo každá rodina, ktorá bola pri moci, bola dynastiou, ktorá sa do dejín zapísala výrazným spôsobom. Medzi každou dynastiou bolo tiež nestabilné obdobie rozdelených provincií. Najznámejším z týchto období bola epocha Troch kráľovstiev, ktorá existovala 60 rokov medzi dynastiou Han a Jin. V týchto obdobiach prebiehala krutá vojna medzi mnohými šľachticmi bojujúcimi o trón. Tri kráľovstvá boli jedným z najkrvavejších období v histórii starej Číny a tisíce ľudí zomreli v bojoch o najvyššiu pozíciu vo veľkom paláci v Si-an.
mt: Ancient China knew a unique way of representing different time periods; each historical period of China or each family that was in power was a dynasty that made its mark on history. Between each dynasty was also a period of unstable provinces. The most famous of these periods was the Epoch of the Three Kingdoms, which existed for 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties. In these periods, a cruel war was waged between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms were one of the bloodiest periods in the history of old China and thousands of people died in the battles for the highest position in the great palace in Si-an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Armáda mravčích kolónií pochoduje a hniezdi tiež v rôznych fázach. V kočovnej fáze, mravci vojaci pochodujú v noci a zastavia sa kempovať cez deň. Kolónia začína kočovnú fázu, keď sa množstvo dostupného jedla zníži. Počas tejto fázy kolónia vytvára dočasné hniezda, ktoré sa menia každý deň. Každý z týchto „nomádskych“ pochodov trvá približne 17 dní.
mt: Ant colonies march and nest in various stages. In the nomadic phase, soldiers march at night and camp during the day. The colony begins the nomadic phase when the amount of available food decreases. During this phase, the colony creates temporary nests, which change every day. Each of these "nomadic" marches lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Mnoho pozorovaných fyziologických rytmov a rytmov v správaní často kriticky závisí od prítomnosti vnútorných cyklov a ich tvorby prostredníctvom biologických hodín. U väčšiny živých bytostí vrátane baktérií, húb, rastlín a živočíchov sú zdokumentované pravidelné rytmy, ktoré nie sú iba reakciou na vonkajšie opakujúce sa signály. Biologické hodiny sú nezávislé oscilátory, ktoré budú pokračovať vo voľnobežnom cykle aj pri absencii podnetov z exerného prostredia.
mt: Many observed physiological rhythms and behaviors often critically depend on the presence of internal cycles and their generation through biological clocks. In most living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals, regular rhythms have been documented that are not merely responses to external recurring signals. Biological clocks are independent oscillators that will continue to cycle freely in the absence of stimuli from the external environment.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Populácia je súbor organizmov konkrétneho druhu v rámci danej geografickej oblasti. Keď sú všetci jedinci v populácii identickí v jednej fenotypickej črte, nazývajú sa monomorfní. Keď jednotlivci vykazujú niekoľko variantov konkrétnej vlastnosti, sú polymorfní.
mt: A population is a set of organisms of a particular type in a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical in one phenotypic trait, they are called monomorphic. When individuals exhibit several variants of a particular trait, they are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Populácia je súbor organizmov konkrétneho druhu v rámci danej geografickej oblasti. Keď sú všetci jedinci v populácii identickí v jednej fenotypickej črte, nazývajú sa monomorfní. Keď jednotlivci vykazujú niekoľko variantov konkrétnej vlastnosti, sú polymorfní.

ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Prírodný turizmus priťahuje ľudí, ktorí majú záujem o návštevu prírodných oblastí s cieľom vychutnať si scenériu vrátane rastlín a zvierat. Medzi príklady aktivít na mieste patrí poľovníctvo, rybolov, fotografovanie, pozorovanie vtákov a návšteva parkov a štúdium informácií o ekosystéme. Ako príklad možno uviesť prehliadky, fotenie a spoznávanie organgatuángov na Borneu.
mt: Natural tourism attracts people who are interested in visiting natural areas to enjoy the scenery including plants and animals. Examples of activities on site include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. For example, tours, photography and tasting of orangutans on Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Ľudia každé ráno kvôli práci opúšťajú malé vidiecke mestá a prechádzajú okolo nich ďalší, ktorí pracujú tam, odkiaľ práve tí prví odišli. Pri tejto kyvadlovej preprave je každý nejakým spôsobom naviazaný na dopravný systém založený na súkromných automobiloch a podporuje ho. Veda teraz naznačuje, že táto masívna „uhlíková“ ekonomika vytlačila stabilný stav biosféry, ktorý podporoval ľudský vývoj ostatné dva milióny rokov.
mt: People every morning leave small rural towns to go to work and pass through those from which they just left. At this pendulum transport, each is somehow connected to the transport system based on private cars and supports it. Science now suggests that this massive "carbon" economy has pushed the stable state of the biosphere, which supported human development the other two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atóm možno považovať za jeden zo základných stavebných prvkov celej hmoty. Je to veľmi zložitá entita, ktorá sa podľa zjednodušeného Bohrovho modelu skladá z centrálneho jadra obiehaného elektrónmi, podobného planétam obiehajúcim okolo Slnka – pozri obrázok 1.1. Jadro sa skladá z dvoch častíc - neutrónov a protónov. Protóny majú kladný elektrický náboj, zatiaľ čo neutróny nemajú žiadny náboj. Elektróny majú negatívny elektrický náboj.
mt: 1.1: The atom can be considered one of the basic building blocks of all matter. It is a very complex entity, which according to the simplified Bohr model consists of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, similar to planets orbiting the Sun. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge, while neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

mt: 1.1: The atom can be considered one of the basic building blocks of all matter. It is a very complex entity, which according to the simplified Bohr model consists of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, similar to planets orbiting the Sun. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge, while neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Prakticky všetky počítače, ktoré sa dnes používajú, sú založené na manipulácii s informáciami, ktoré sú kódované vo forme binárnych čísel. Binárne číslo môže mať iba jednu z dvoch hodnôt, t.j. 0 alebo 1. Tieto čísla sa v počítačovom žargóne označujú ako binárne číslice alebo bity.
mt: 99% of the computers in use today are based on manipulating information that is encoded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1. These numbers are referred to as binary digits or bits in computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Blogy tiež môžu pomôcť zlepšiť písanie študentov. Zatiaľ čo študenti často začínajú svoju skúsenosť s blogovaním s nedbalou gramatikou a pravopisom, prítomnosť publika to spravidla zmení. Pretože študenti sú často najkritickejším publikom, autor blogu sa usiluje zlepšiť písanie, aby sa kritike vyhol. Pri blogovaní sú „študenti nútení viac sa orientovať na svet okolo“. Potreba uspokojiť záujem publika tak inšpiruje študentov, aby sa stali šikovnejší a venovali sa svojim záujmom (Toto, 2004). Blogovanie je nástroj, ktorý podnecuje k spolupráci a povzbudzuje študentov, aby sa vzdelávanie rozšírilo ďaleko nad rámec tradičného školského dňa. Vhodné použitie blogov „umožní študentom, aby prehĺbili svoje analytické a kritické myslenie; prostredníctvom aktívnej odpovede na internetové materiály môžu študenti definovať svoje postoje v kontexte spisov iných ako aj načrtnúť svoje vlastné pohľady na konkrétne problémy (Oravec, 2002).
mt: Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blogging experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience usually changes that. Because students are often their own harshest critics, the blogger is motivated to improve writing to avoid criticism. Blogging forces students to be more attuned to the world around them. The need to satisfy an audience inspires students to become more skilled and to pursue their interests (This, 2004). Blogging is a tool that encourages collaboration and motivates students to extend learning beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs “allows students to deepen their analytical and critical thinking; through active response to online materials, students can define their positions in the context of the writings of others and sketch their own perspectives on specific issues (Oravec, 2002).
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Asynchrónna komunikácia napomáha čas na premýšľanie a odozvu na ostatných. Umožňuje študentom, aby pracovali podľa vlastného tempa a určovali tempo inštruktívnych informácií. Okrem toho existuje menej časových obmedzení s možnosťou flexibilného pracovného času. (Bremer, 1998) Používanie internetu a www siete poskytuje študentom stály prístup k informáciám. Študenti tiež môžu inštruktorom posielať otázky kedykoľvek počas dňa a dostať celkom rýchlu odpoveď. Takto nemusia čakať na ďalšie osobné stretnutie.
mt: Asynchronous communication allows time for thinking and response. It allows students to work at their own pace and set the pace of instructional information. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web provides students with constant access to information. Students can also send questions to instructors at any time during the day and get a very quick response. This way they do not have to wait for the next personal meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Tradičný stredoveký hrad už dlho inšpiroval predstavivosť a vytváral obrazy turnajov, hostín a artušovského rytierstva. Napriek tomu, že stojíte uprostred tisícročných zrúcanín, v mysli sa vám ľahko vynárajú predstavy zvukov a vôní pradávnych bitiek, takmer počujete klepot kopýt na dlažbe a cítite strach stúpajúci z podzemných žalárov. Je však naša fantázia založená na skutočnosti? Prečo boli vôbec hrady postavené? Ako boli navrhnuté a postavené?
mt: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination and created images of tournaments, feasts and Arthurian chivalry. Despite the fact that you stand in the midst of thousand-year-old ruins, your imagination easily conjures up sounds and smells of ancient battles, almost hear the clatter of hooves on the pavement and feel the fear rising from the underground dungeons. Is our fantasy based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Toto obdobie charakterizuje hrad Kirby Muxloe, ktorý pripomína skôr opevnený dom ako skutočný hrad. Jeho veľké zasklené okná a tenké steny by neboli schopné odolať odhodlanému útoku nadlho. V 80. rokoch 15. storočia, keď s jeho výstavbou začal lord Hastings, vládol v krajine relatívny pokoj a obrana bola potrebná iba proti malým skupinám potulných lúpežníkov.
mt: This period is characterized by Kirby Muxloe Castle, which more resembles a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glass windows and thin walls would not be able to withstand a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction began under Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only necessary against small groups of wandering robbers.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Pri prechode z behu na štvrť míle na beh na pol míle sa rýchlosť stáva oveľa menej dôležitou a vytrvalosť absolútne nevyhnutnou. Je samozrejmosťou, že prvotriedny bežec na pol míle, ktorý dokáže pokoriť dobu 2 minút, musí oplývať mimoriadnou rýchlosťou. Avšak vytrvalosť je nutné pestovať za každých okolností. Kombinácia cezpoľného behu počas zimy a cvičenia v posilňovni so zameraním na hornú časť tela sú tou najlepšiu prípravou na bežeckú sezónu.
mt: As the transition from the quarter-mile to the half-mile occurs, speed becomes much less important and endurance absolutely necessary. It is a certainty that the top-ranked half-miler who can run the 2-minute barrier must possess extraordinary speed. However, endurance must be cultivated at all times. A combination of cross-country running in the winter and weight training with an emphasis on the upper body are the best preparations for the track season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Správne výživové postupy samy o sebe nemôžu vytvárať vrcholové výkony, avšak môžu významne ovplyvniť celkovú pohodu mladých športovcov. Udržiavanie zdravej energetickej rovnováhy, vytváranie účinných hydratačných návykov a porozumenie rôznym aspektom užívania doplnkov môže športovcom pomôcť zlepšiť výkonnosť a umocniť radosť zo športu.
mt: Proper nutrition alone cannot create peak performances, but it can significantly influence the overall well-being of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, creating effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplement use can help athletes improve performance and enhance the joy of sport.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Beh na stredné trate je relatívne lacný šport, avšak existuje veľa mylných predstáv o tých pár kusoch vybavenia, ktoré sú potrebné na účasť. Výrobky je možné zakúpiť podľa potreby, ale väčšina z nich bude mať malý alebo žiadny ozajstný dopad na výkon. Športovci môžu cítiť, že dávajú prednosť výrobku, aj keď im neprináša žiadnu ozajstnú pridanú hodnotu.
mt: A run on the middle distances is a relatively cheap sport, but there are many misconceptions about the few pieces of equipment that are needed to participate. Items can be purchased as needed, but most of them will have little or no actual impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they are giving preference to a product, even though it does not provide any actual added value.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: MRI sa zakladá na fyzikálnom jave označovanom ako nukleárna magnetická rezonancia (NMR), ktorý objavili v 30-tych rokoch minulého storočia Felix Bloch (pracujúci na Standfordskej univerzite) a Edward Purcell (z Harvardskej univerzity). Pôsobením magnetického poľa a rádiových vĺn pri tejto rezonancii vysielajú atómy maličké rádiové signály. V roku 1970 objavil lekár a vedecký pracovník Raymond Damadian základ pre použitie zobrazovania pomocou magnetickej rezonancie ako nástroja lekárskej diagnostiky. O štyri roky neskôr bol udelený patent, ktorý bol zároveň prvým patentom na svete v oblasti MRI. V roku 1977 doktor Damadian skonštruoval prvý „celotelový“ MRI skener, ktorý nazval „Nezlomný“.
mt: MRI is based on the physical phenomenon known as nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). By applying a magnetic field and radio waves to this resonance, atoms emit tiny radio signals. In 1970, physician and scientific researcher Raymond Damadian laid the foundation for the use of magnetic resonance imaging as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later, a patent was granted, which was also the first patent in the world in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian constructed the first "whole-body" MRI scanner, which he named "Fragile".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Ľudia sú zďaleka tými najšikovnejšími prírodnými druhmi v čítaní myšlienok ostatných. To znamená, že dokážeme úspešne predpokladať, čo iní ľudia vnímajú, aké majú úmysly, v čo veria, čo vedia alebo po čom túžia. Pochopenie úmyslu ostatných je spomedzi týchto schopností rozhodujúce. Umožňuje nám to vyriešiť prípadné dvojznačnosti fyzických skutkov. Napríklad, keby ste videli, ako niekto rozbíja okná na aute, pravdepodobne by ste usúdili, že sa pokúša o krádež auta cudzieho človeka. Keby stratil kľúče od auta a auto do, do ktorého by sa snažil vlámať by bolo jeho vlastné, bolo by potrebné ho posudzovať inak.
mt: People are far and away the most successful natural species at reading the minds of others. This means that we can successfully predict what others perceive, what they intend, what they believe, what they know, or what they desire. Understanding the intentions of others is among these abilities decisive. It allows us to resolve ambiguities in physical actions. For example, if you saw someone breaking the windows of a car, you would probably conclude that he was trying to steal a car belonging to another person. If he lost the keys to the car and was trying to break into a car that was his own, he would have to be judged differently.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: AI má silnú konotáciu science fiction a tvorí významné odvetvie počítačovej vedy, ktoré sa zaoberá správaním, učením a inteligentnou adaptáciou robotov. Výskum v oblasti UI zahŕňa výrobu strojov na automatizáciu úloh, ktoré si vyžadujú inteligentné správanie. Prípady zahŕňajú kontrolu, plánovanie a rozvrhovanie, schopnosť odpovedať na diagnózy a otázky zákazníkov, ako aj rozpoznávanie rukopisu, hlasu a tváre. Tieto sa stali samostatnými disciplínami, ktoré sa sústreďujú na poskytovanie riešení problémov zo života. Umelá inteligencia sa dnes často používa v oblasti ekonómie, medicíny, strojárstva a armády, keďže bol zabudovaný do niekoľkých aplikácií v domácich počítačoch, či aplikácií v softvéroch videohier.
mt: AI has a strong science fiction connotation and forms a major subdiscipline of computer science that deals with designing, learning, and intelligent adaptation of robots. Research in the field of AI includes the production of machines capable of automating tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to respond to customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting, voice, and face recognition. These have become separate disciplines that focus on providing solutions to life problems. Artificial intelligence is now commonly used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering, and the military, as it has been built into several applications in home computers, or applications in software video games.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Konvergentné vzory myslenia sú metódy riešenia problémov, ktoré spájajú rôzne myšlienky alebo oblasti s cieľom nájsť riešenie. Takéto myslenie sa zameriava na rýchlosť, logiku a presnosť. Ale tiež na identifikáciu faktov, opätovné využitie existujúcich techník či zhromažďovanie informácií. Najdôležitejším faktorom tohto myslenia je, že existuje len jediná správna odpoveď. Vyberáte iba z dvoch odpovedí, a to správnej alebo nesprávnej. Tento typ myslenia je spojený s istým typom vedy alebo štandardnými postupmi. Ľudia s týmto typom myslenia majú logické myslenie, sú schopní si pamätať si vzorce, riešiť problémy a pracovať na vedeckých testoch.
mt: Convergent thinking is a method of problem solving that combines different ideas or areas with the goal of finding a solution. Such thinking focuses on speed, logic, and accuracy. But also on identifying facts, reusing existing techniques or gathering information. The most important factor of this thinking is that there is only one correct answer. You choose only from two answers, and that is correct or incorrect. This type of thinking is associated with a certain type of science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to remember formulas, solve problems, and work on scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Používanie videozáznamu viedlo k významným odhaleniam v interpretácii mikrovýrazov a mimických pohybov tváre, ktoré majú trvanie iba zopár milisekúnd. Presnejšie sa tvrdí, že správnym výkladom mikroprejavov sa dá zistiť, či osoba klame. Oliver Sacks vo svojej práci Prezidentova reč ukázal, že ľudia, ktorí nedokážu porozumieť reči z dôvodu poškodenia mozgu, dokážu presne posúdiť úprimnosť prejavu. Dokonca naznačuje, že takéto schopnosti pri interpretácii ľudského správania môžu zdieľať aj zvieratá, ako napríklad psy domáce.
mt: The use of video footage has led to significant revelations in the interpretation of micro-expressions and facial mimics, which last only a few milliseconds. It is claimed that a correct interpretation of micro-expressions can determine whether a person is lying. Oliver Sacks in his work The President's Speech showed that people who cannot understand speech due to brain damage can accurately judge the sincerity of an expression. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals, such as domestic dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Tak ako je uvedené vyššie, zmenila sa schopnosť získavať vedomosti a učiť sa a zmenila sa aj základná rýchlosť, pri ktorej sa získavajú vedomosti. Prístup k získavaniu informácií bol iný. Tlak už nebol na vybavení si niečoho konkrétneho, ale pozornosť sa sústredila na schopnosť vybaviť si text. Renesancia v podstate zohrala významnú rolu v zmene prístupu k učeniu a šíreniu vedomostí.
mt: As mentioned above, the ability to acquire knowledge and learn has changed, and the basic speed at which knowledge is acquired has changed. The approach to acquiring information was different. The pressure was no longer on equipping oneself with something specific, but attention was focused on the ability to equip oneself with text. The Renaissance in essence played a significant role in changing the approach to learning and spreading knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Internet kombinuje prvky hromadnej aj medziľudskej komunikácie. Jedinečné vlastnosti internetu vedú v prípade teórie použitia a uspokojenia k ďalším možnostiam. Napríklad, existuje predpoklad, že „učenie“ a „socializácia“ sú dôležitými motivátormi pre využívanie internetu (James a iní, 1995). Pri výskume reakcií publika na webové stránky, Eighmey a McCord (1998) identifikovali „osobnú angažovanosť“ a „pretrvávajúce vzťahy“ ako motivujúce aspekty.
mt: The Internet combines elements of mass and interpersonal communication. The unique characteristics of the Internet lead to the use and satisfaction of the Internet in other ways. For example, there is a presumption that "learning" and "socialization" are important motivators for using the Internet (James et al., 1995). In a study of audience reactions to web sites, Eighmey and McCord (1998) identified "personal involvement" and "sustained relationships" as motivating aspects.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Gotický štýl vrcholil v období medzi 10. a 11. storočím a v 14. storočí. Zo začiatku odev výrazne ovplyvňovala byzantská kultúra na východe. Kvôli pomalým komunikačným kanálom však štýly na západe mohli zaostávať aj o 25 až 30 rokov. ku koncu stredoveku začala západná Európa rozvíjať svoj vlastný štýl. K najväčším výdobytkom tej doby, ktoré priniesli so sebou križiacke výpravy, patria gombíky. Začali sa používať na zapínanie odevov.
mt: The Gothic style peaked between the 10th and 11th centuries and in the 14th century. From the beginning, the clothing style was influenced by Byzantine culture in the east. Due to slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 years. By the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. Among the greatest achievements of the time, which brought with them the Crusades, were buttons. They began to be used to fasten clothing.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Môžeme sa začať správať ohľaduplnejšie k životnému prostrediu, môžeme sa pripojiť k environmentálnemu hnutiu a dokonca sa môžeme stať aktivistami, aby sme do istej miery znížili utrpenie v budúcnosti. Ako v mnohých prípadoch, ide o niečo ako je symptomatická liečba. Avšak, ak nechceme len dočasné riešenie, mali by sme prísť na koreň problémov a mali by sme ich zlikvidovať. Je zrejmé, že svet sa vďaka vedeckému a technologickému pokroku ľudstva veľmi zmenil a preľudnenie a extravagantný životný štýl ľudí problémy len zhoršuje.
mt: We can start treating the environment more responsibly, we can join the environmental movement and even become activists, in order to reduce suffering in the future to some extent. As in many cases, it is symptomatic treatment. However, if we do not want to just a temporary solution, we should come to the root of the problems and eliminate them. It is obvious that the world has changed a lot thanks to scientific and technological progress of mankind and overpopulation and extravagant lifestyle of people only worsens the problems.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Rovnováha síl bola systém, v ktorom sa európske národy usilovali o udržanie národnej nezávislosti všetkých európskych štátov. Koncepcia spočívala v tom, že všetky európske národy sa mali snažiť zabrániť tomu, aby sa jeden národ stal mocným, z toho dôvodu národné vlády často menili svoje spojenectvá, aby udržali rovnováhu. Vojna o nástupníctvo v Španielsku bola prvou vojnou, ktorej ústrednou otázkou bola rovnováha síl. To znamenalo dôležitú zmenu, pretože európske mocnosti by už nemali zámienku na to, aby viedli náboženské vojny. Tridsaťročná vojna bola teda poslednou vojnou, ktorá bola označená za náboženskú.
mt: The Balance of Power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the independence of all European states. The concept was that all European nations should try to prevent one nation from becoming too powerful, so that national governments often changed their alliances to maintain the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession was the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This meant an important change, because European powers would no longer have an excuse to wage religious wars. The Thirty Years' War was therefore the last war that was designated as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Rovnováha síl bola systém, v ktorom sa európske národy usilovali o udržanie národnej nezávislosti všetkých európskych štátov. Koncepcia spočívala v tom, že všetky európske národy sa mali snažiť zabrániť tomu, aby sa jeden národ stal mocným, z toho dôvodu národné vlády často menili svoje spojenectvá, aby udržali rovnováhu. Vojna o nástupníctvo v Španielsku bola prvou vojnou, ktorej ústrednou otázkou bola rovnováha síl. To znamenalo dôležitú zmenu, pretože európske mocnosti by už nemali zámienku na to, aby viedli náboženské vojny. Tridsaťročná vojna bola teda poslednou vojnou, ktorá bola označená za náboženskú.
mt: The Balance of Power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the independence of all European states. The concept was that all European nations should try to prevent one nation from becoming too powerful, so that national governments often changed their alliances to maintain the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession was the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This meant an important change, because European powers would no longer have an excuse to wage religious wars. The Thirty Years' War was therefore the last war that was designated as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: V tomto období európskych dejín sa pod drobnohľad dostala katolícka cirkev, ktorá zbohatla a zmocnela. Viac ako tisícročia kresťanstvo spájalo dohromady európske krajiny napriek rozdielom v jazykoch a zvykoch. Jeho všadeprítomná sila ovplyvnila každého, od kráľa po obyčajného človeka. Jednou z hlavných kresťanských zásad je, že bohatstvo by sa malo používať na zmiernenie utrpenia a chudoby a že peňažné prostriedky cirkvi by mali slúžiť práve na tieto účely. Cirkev bola ako ústredná autorita v Ríme prítomná už viac ako tisíc rokov a táto koncentrácia moci a peňazí viedla mnohých k otázkam, či sa jej zásady dodržiavajú.
mt: In this period of European history, the Catholic Church came under scrutiny, which had grown rich and powerful. For more than a thousand years, Christianity had united European countries despite differences in language and customs. Its pervasive influence affected everyone, from kings to ordinary people. One of the main Christian principles is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty, and that church funds should serve precisely these purposes. The Church, as the central authority in Rome, had been present for more than a thousand years, and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether its principles were being upheld.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Dav trhovkýň zahnal 6. októbra 1789 vystrašeného kráľa Ľudovíta XVI., kráľovnú Máriu Antoinettu, ich dve malé deti (11-ročnú Máriu Teréziu a štvorročného Louis-Charlesa) a kráľovu sestru, madam Alžbetu, z Versailles späť do Paríža. Späť do Paríža cestovali na voze, pričom ich sprevádzal rozhnevaný dav kričiacich ľudí, ktorí sa kráľovi a kráľovnej vyhrážali. Dav ľudí prinútil kráľa a kráľovnú, aby mali okná koča otvorené dokorán. V jednom okamihu niekto z davu pred vydesenou kráľovnou zamával hlavou kráľovskej stráže, ktorú sťali vo Versailles.
mt: 6 October 1789, a mob of market women drove a frightened Louis XVI, his queen Marie Antoinette, their two small children (11-year-old Marie Therese and 4-year-old Louis-Charles) and the king's sister, Madame Elizabeth, back to Paris from Versailles. They traveled in a carriage, while a mob of shouting people followed them, threatening the king and queen. The mob forced the king and queen to keep the windows of the carriage open all the way. At one point, someone from the mob waved his head at the king's guard, who was decapitated in Versailles.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Krátko po vypuknutí nepriateľských akcií začala Británia námornú blokádu Nemecka. Stratégia sa ukázala ako účinná, pretože sa jej podarilo prerušiť životne dôležité vojenské a civilné dodávky. A to aj napriek tomu, že táto blokáda porušila všeobecne akceptované medzinárodné právo kodifikované niekoľkými medzinárodnými dohodami z uplynulých dvoch storočí. Británia podmínovala medzinárodné vody, aby zabránila akýmkoľvek lodiam vstúpiť do celých častí oceánu, čo spôsobilo nebezpečenstvo dokonca aj pre neutrálne lode. Keďže na túto taktiku bola iba minimálna reakcia, Nemecko očakávalo podobnú odpoveď na svoju neobmedzenú ponorkovú vojnu.
mt: Shortly after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain imposed a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, as it was able to disrupt vital military and civilian supplies. This, despite the fact that this blockade violated the generally accepted international law codified by several international treaties of the past two centuries. Britain imposed international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire parts of the ocean, which posed a threat even to neutral ships. Since there was only a minimal reaction to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: V Spojených štátoch amerických je zaznamenaných okolo 400 000 prípadov sklerózy multiplex (SM), čím patrí medzi popredné neurologické ochorenia u dospelých v mladšom a strednom veku. MS je ochorenie, ktoré postihuje centrálnu nervovú sústavu, ktorú tvorí mozog, miecha a očný nerv. Výskum ukazuje, že pravdepodobnosť výskytu MS u žien je dvojnásobne vyššia v porovnaní s mužmi.
mt: 400,000 cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) have been reported in the United States, making it one of the most common neurological diseases in young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which includes the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerve. Research shows that the likelihood of MS in women is twice that of men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Výskum ukázal, že depresia, strach a katastrofické myslenie súvisia s bolesťou a zdravotným postihnutím u pacientov s bolesťami v dolnej časti chrbtice. Podmienkou pravidelných týždenných štruktúrovaných relácií fyzickej aktivity boli iba účinky tzv. katastrofizácie, nie depresie a strachu. Tí, ktorí majú pravidelné aktivity, potrebovali väčšiu podporu pri negatívnom vnímaní bolesti, ktoré odlišuje rozdiely od chronickej bolesti a pocitu nepohodlia pri bežnom fyzickom pohybe.
mt: A study showed that depression, fear and catastrophic thinking are associated with pain and health impairment in patients with low back pain. Only the effects of so-called catastrophizing, not depression and fear, were required for regular weekly structured physical activity. Those who had regular activities needed greater support in negative pain perception, which distinguishes it from chronic pain and discomfort during normal physical movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: S moderným šermom sa stretnete na rôznych úrovniach, od študentov na univerzitách až po profesionálne a olympijské súťaže. Primárne sa šport hrá ako duel, v ktorom jeden šermiar vyzýva na súboj druhého.
mt: Fencing is played at various levels, from students at universities to professional and Olympic competitions. Primarily, the sport is played as a duel, in which one fencer challenges another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Vnútorná otrava nemusí byť ihneď zrejmá. Symptómy ako zvracanie sú totiž príliš všeobecné na to, aby mohla byť stanovená okamžitá diagnóza. Najrýchlejším znakom, podľa ktorého sa dá určiť, že ide o vnútornú otravu, je prítomnosť otvoreného obalu s liekmi alebo toxickými domácimi čistiacimi chemikáliami. Pohľadajte na štítku stanovené pokyny na poskytnutie prvej pomoci týkajúce sa tejto konkrétnej otravy.
mt: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms such as vomiting are too general to be used to make an immediate diagnosis. The quickest sign that it is internal poisoning is the presence of an open container of medicine or toxic household cleaning chemicals. Look at the label for instructions on providing first aid for this specific poisoning.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Ak chcete skontrolovať obeť, musíte v prvom rade preskúmať miesto, aby ste zaistili svoju bezpečnosť. Keď sa blížite k obeti, je potrebné si všimnúť jej polohu a akékoľvek zjavné varovné signály. Ak sa pri pokuse o pomoc zraníte, môžete situáciu len zhoršiť.
mt: To check on a victim, you must first survey the area to ensure your own safety. When approaching the victim, you should note their position and any obvious warning signs. If you attempt to help and injure yourself, you may only make the situation worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

mt: To check on a victim, you must first survey the area to ensure your own safety. When approaching the victim, you should note their position and any obvious warning signs. If you attempt to help and injure yourself, you may only make the situation worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Sú badateľné mnohé spoločenské a politické javy, ako napríklad používanie metrickej sústavy, odklon od samovlády k republikanizmu, nacionalizmus a presvedčenie, že krajina patrí ľuďom, nie jedinému panovníkovi. Aj po revolúcii boli zamestnania dostupné pre všetkých mužských uchádzačov a takto umožnili uspieť tým najambicióznejším a najúspešnejším. To isté platí pre armádu, pretože namiesto toho, aby sa armádne hodnosti zakladali na triede, prešli na kaliber. Francúzska revolúcia inšpirovala aj mnoho ďalších utláčaných robotníkov z iných krajín k tomu, aby začali vlastnú revolúciu.
mt: Many social and political phenomena are well documented, such as the shift from autocracy to republicanism, nationalism, and the belief that the country belongs to the people, not to a single ruler. Even after the revolution, jobs were available to all male applicants, thus allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. The same applies to the army, because instead of basing military ranks on class, they shifted to caliber. The French Revolution inspired many other oppressed workers from other countries to start their own revolution.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Každý sa zúčastňuje života v spoločnosti a používa dopravné systémy. Takmer každý sa sťažuje na dopravné systémy. Vo vyspelých krajinách zriedka počujete podobné sťažnosti na kvalitu vody alebo padanie mostov. Prečo dopravné systémy vyvolávajú veľké množstvo sťažností, prečo každodenne zlyhávajú? Sú len dopravní inžinieri neschopní? Alebo ide o niečo zásadnejšie?
mt: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries, you rarely hear similar complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems generate so much complaint, why do they fail so often? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental at work?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Dopravný tok je výsledkom pozorovania pohybu individuálnych šoférov a vozidiel medzi dvoma bodmi a sledovania ich vzájomných interakcií. Bohužiaľ, štúdium dopravného toku je náročné, pretože správanie vodiča sa nedá predpovedať so stopercentnou istotou. Vodiči majú našťastie tendenciu správať sa primerane konzistentne a preto sa konzistentne často správajú aj dopravné toky, ktoré môžu byť približne matematicky znázornené. Pre názornejšie reprezentovanie dopravného prúdu boli zadefinované vzťahy medzi týmito tromi hlavnými charakteristikami: (1) intenzita, (2) hustota a (3) rýchlosť. Tieto vzťahy pomáhajú pri plánovaní, projektovaní a prevádzke pozemných komunikácií.
mt: Traffic flow is the result of observing the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and tracking their mutual interactions. Unfortunately, the study of traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with 100% certainty. Drivers, however, tend to behave consistently and therefore consistently often behave similarly to traffic flows, which can be approximately mathematically represented. For more illustrative representation of traffic flow, relationships between these three main characteristics were defined: (1) intensity, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning, designing, and operating land communications.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Experiment vykonaný Hersheyom a Chasem patril medzi hlavné príznaky, že DNA je genetický materiál. Na implantáciu svojej DNA do baktérie používali Hershey s Chaseom fágy alebo vírusy. Urobili dva experimenty s označením buď DNA vo fágu rádioaktívnym fosforom alebo proteín fágu rádioaktívnou sírou.
mt: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the main demonstrations that DNA is the genetic material. In their implantation of DNA into a bacterium, Hershey and Chase used phage or viruses. They performed two experiments, either labeling the DNA in the phage with radioactive phosphorus or the phage protein with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mutácie môžu mať rôzne účinky v závislosti od ich typu, významu zasiahnutej časti genetického materiálu a od toho, či sú ovplyvnené bunky zárodočnými bunkami. Na deti sa môžu preniesť iba mutácie v zárodočných bunkách, zatiaľ čo iné mutácie môžu spôsobiť bunkovú smrť alebo rakovinu.
mt: Mutations can have different effects depending on their type, the significance of the affected genetic material, and whether they affect germ cells. Only mutations in germ cells can be passed to children, while other mutations can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Zdá sa, že kozy boli prvýkrát domestikované zhruba pred 10 000 rokmi v iránskom pohorí Zagros. Staroveké kultúry a kmene ich začali chovať pre jednoduchý prístup k mlieku, srsti, mäsu a kožiam. Domáce kozy sa zvyčajne chovali v stádach, ktoré sa potulovali po kopcoch alebo iných pastvinách, a často ich pásli pastieri kôz, ktorí boli často deťmi alebo dospievajúcimi, podobne ako všeobecne známy pastier. Tieto spôsoby stádovania sa používajú dodnes.
mt: It appears that goats were first domesticated about 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to raise them for easy access to milk, wool, meat and skin. Domestic goats were usually kept in herds that roamed hills or other pastures, and often were tended by shepherds who were often children or adolescents, as is generally known for shepherds. These methods of herding are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golf je hra, v ktorej hráči používajú palice na odpaľovanie loptičiek do jamiek. V bežnom kole sa hrá osemnásť jamiek, pričom na ihrisku hráči spravidla začínajú na prvej a končia na osemnástej jamke. Vyhráva hráč, ktorý na dokončenie ihriska urobí najmenej úderov alebo švihov palicou. Hrá sa na tráve. Trávnik okolo jamky je kosený nakrátko a nazýva sa jamkovisko.
mt: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. In a typical round, players play 18 holes, with players usually starting on the first hole and ending on the eighteenth hole. The player who completes the course in the fewest strokes or hits wins. The course is played on grass. The grass around the hole is cut short and is called the green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Hlavným cieľom vedy je vedeckými metódami zistiť, ako funguje svet. Tieto metódy v skutočnosti poháňajú väčšinu vedeckého výskumu. Nie je to však iba o experimentácii, a experiment je test, ktorý sa používa na elimináciu jednej alebo viacerých možných hypotéz. Kladenie otázok a postrehy pri pozorovaní tiež dokážu pomôcť nasmerovať vedecký výskum.
mt: The main goal of science is to use scientific methods to find out how the world works. These methods in fact drive most scientific research. It's not just about experimentation, and an experiment is a test used to eliminate one or more possible hypotheses. Asking questions and observations can also help to guide scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Tornáda zasiahnu malú oblasť v porovnaní s inými silnými búrkami, môžu však zničiť všetko, čo im príde do cesty. Tornáda vyvracajú stromy, vytrhávajú dosky z budov a vyhadzujú autá do vzduchu. Najintenzívnejšie tornáda, čo sú dve percentá, trvajú viac ako tri hodiny. Tieto obrovské búrky dosahujú rýchlosť vetra až do 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 míľ/h).
mt: Tornadoes affect a small area compared to other strong storms, but can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes tear up trees, rip roofs off buildings and toss cars into the air. The most intense tornadoes, which are two percent, last more than three hours. These giant storms can reach wind speeds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Ľudstvo už tisícky rokov na zväčšovanie vyrába a používa šošovky. Prvé ozajstné ďalekohľady však boli vyrobené v Európe na konci 16. storočia. Tieto teleskopy použili kombináciu dvoch šošoviek na to, aby sa vzdialené objekty javili bližšie a väčšie.
mt: Humans have been making and using lenses for thousands of years. The first true telescopes were made in Europe at the end of the 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Mohamed sa o záležitosti presahujúce pozemský život hlboko zaujímal. Často chodil rozjímať do jaskyne, ktorá sa stala známa ako Hira, na hore Noor (svetlo). Samotná jaskyňa, ktorá prežila dlhú dobu, poskytuje veľmi živý obraz o Mohamedových duchovných sklonoch. Ležiac na vrchole jedného z vrchov na severe Mekky, jaskyňa je úplne izolovaná od zvyšku sveta. V skutočnosti vôbec nie je ľahké dostať sa do nej, aj keby človek vedel, kde sa nachádza. Akonáhle sa ocitnete v jaskyni, ste úplne izolovaní. Nie je vidieť nič iné ako jasnú, krásnu oblohu a množstvo okolitých hôr. Veľmi málo z tohto sveta je vidieť alebo počuť z vnútra jaskyne.
mt: Mohamed was deeply interested in matters beyond the earthly life. He often went to meditate in the cave, which became known as Hira, on the mountain Noor (light). The cave itself, which has survived for a long time, provides a very vivid picture of Mohamed's spiritual inclinations. Located on top of one of the peaks north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not at all easy to get to it, even if a person knew where it was. Once you are in the cave, you are completely isolated. Nothing else can be seen or heard from inside the cave except a bright, beautiful sky and a multitude of surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: V Anglicku boli železnice postavené už v 16. storočí. Hoci vozne pozostávali iba z rovnobežných drevených dosiek, umožňovali ťažným koňom dosiahovať vyššiu rýchlosť a ťahať väčšie bremená ako na vtedajších cestách, ktoré boli o niečo drsnejšie. Podvaly boli zavedené pomerne skoro, aby držali koľaje na svojom mieste. Avšak neskôr sa zistilo, že koľaje by boli efektívnejšie, keby mali na vrchu železný pásik. To sa stalo bežnou praxou, ale železo spôsobilo väčšie opotrebenie drevených kolies vozňov. Drevené kolesá sa nakoniec nahradili kolesami zo železa. V roku 1767 sa zaviedli prvé celoželezné koľajnice.
mt: 16th century English railways were built with wooden rails. Although the wagons consisted only of parallel wooden planks, they allowed heavy horses to achieve a higher speed and pull heavier loads than on the contemporary roads, which were a little rougher. Underframes were introduced fairly soon to keep the rails in place. However, it was later found that rails would be more effective if they had an iron strip on top. This became standard practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wagon wheels. Wooden wheels were eventually replaced by wheels made of iron. In 1767, the first all-iron rails were introduced.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
